programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin becomes the subject of a personal and deadly vendetta when a reviled rapist and murderer she put away is released from jail.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny investigates when a doorman at a nightclub is murdered; Frank makes a decision about a former partner's future.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Jackie investigate the murder of a high-end escort after her body is found floating in the East River.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny must delve into the family politics of the Russian mob while investigating the death of a gangster's son; Erin becomes involved in a high-profile corruption case.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny investigates the shooting of an undercover counterterrorism agent who was involved with infiltrating a sleeper cell.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will wins so much money in Las Vegas that he considers buying his own truck and working alone.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will and Sonny deliver two trucks to an eccentric old lady who has an antique Benz that she restored herself. The next day, it's gone and she accuses them of stealing it.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny and Will's financial future rides on a racing greyhound they received in lieu of a payment.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: While detouring around a construction site, Will and Sonny are trapped by a landslide, along with six other people including a runaway, an alcoholic trumpeter and a med student.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: An insurance investigator is out to jail Sonny and Will for insurance fraud.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A Detective from Atlanta pays Nick and Sylvie to help in search of the local coroner's brother, who is in possession of the heart of a dead crime lord. The heart contains the evidence that there was fowl play in his death, and now the police and the real killer have descended on Key Mariah to find him, and more importantly the heart.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: After Sylvie shoots and kills a perp, her world shatters when she is told that the dead man was an undercover cop and she ends up in jail. Nick refuses to believe that the shooting was unjustified and investigates the cop's background.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride listens in on a wiretap of Mayor Hamilton; the NCIS team investigates when Navy weapons get stolen in a train heist; featuring musical performances by Sheryl Crow.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The murder of a Navy chaplain leads Pride to uncover a possible connection between Mayor Hamilton and illegal activity taking place in the city of Clearwater; Percy continues to face repercussions of her choices on a previous case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Pride is spotted tracking one of Mayor Hamilton's accomplices on a crowded street, the suspect opens fire, putting innocent lives at risk before disappearing.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A tragic crime leads the team closer to the Beck family and their deadly ideology; Ruzek makes progress infiltrating the Becks, earning Samantha and Richard's trust with a bold move.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Atwater's worlds collide when a shooting at the building he owns in Burnside leaves a child dead; Atwater must confront his relationship with his father, Lew, as the brutal case forces them together.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Upton is unwittingly drawn into a deadly betrayal and finds herself in a fight for her life; with minimal leads, Voight and the team scramble to find her before it's too late.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Torres finds himself in the midst of a murder case that hits close to home and threatens to expose his troubled past; as he struggles to reconcile his old life with his new one, Voight keeps a watchful eye.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: As Richard Beck's timeline for a deadly attack moves up and Samantha panics, Ruzek and the team scramble to get ahead of unprecedented disaster.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Tasked with shadowing a crisis prevention team, Upton finds her approach to policing at odds with the team's mental health clinician; Voight stands by Upton as she continues to struggle in her personal life.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek gets mixed up in a case after a late-night poker game is raided; afraid of becoming like his father, Ruzek struggles to stand down and allow Intelligence to carry out the investigation while he remains on leave.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Burgess works an extra shift at the 13th District and gets caught in the middle of a drive-by attack on refugees; the team works together to track down the shooter and uncover the true motive behind the attack.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Atwater turns to an unlikely source of support when a string of jewelry store robberies shakes his confidence.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence teams up with ASA Chapman to take on an abduction case involving a teenager; the case hits close to home for Voight, leading him to take a personal interest in finding justice for the victim.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: An ongoing case hits close to home for Voight as Intelligence teams up with an SVU detective to track down a prolific offender.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Upton brings SVU detective Petrovic back into the fold to help with the investigation of a tender-age kidnapping.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Upton becomes consumed with a decades-old missing persons case linked to Petrovic after a young child shows up to the district seeking help.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: As Atwater finds himself distracted by a past case, a CI from his past resurfaces with a tip on a string of armed robberies that are raising concerns.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An old contact of Nick brings one of the DEA's top ten deadly assassins to the Key Mariah who is looking to settle an old score.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: While in the company of friends, Spider tells a tale of one of Nick and Sylvie's cases the way he remembers it.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A gang tricks Nick into helping them commit a robbery. He gets arrested immediately. While Sylvie and Spider ask around outside, he looks for members of the gang among the other prisoners.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman uses Nick to get rid of her husband - permanently.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A man blackmails Nick to force him to participate in a casino heist.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Katie, Sylvie's niece, arrives in town. She is suppose to work as a model. Unfortunately a murder interrupts her plans.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Defying gravity is Phil's mission, but maxing out a hoop glider proves to be harder than it seems; an egg drop with a pumpkin, hovering helium balloons and more anti-gravity fun.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: How a generator works, make your own wind turbine and a solar panel described with a bathtub and ping-pong balls!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Animals who live in the freezing arctic: the polar bear; the wolverine.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Dogs: greyhounds' speed, bloodhounds' noses and border collies' brains.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we see how nature can sometimes be the best classroom. Philippe heads to Key Largo to join a high school class getting up close with local sea grass habitats. Then we head to the streams of Pennsylvania to go on a 'Bio-Blitz' surveying aquatic insects. From there it's up to the Pacific Northwest to see how volunteers use camera traps to keep tabs on elusive animals.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we look at our microscopic world. Philippe heads to the University of Texas to break down the microscopic world of sand. He'll stay on campus to then look at how microscopic science plays a role in researching fire ants. From there it's off to the University of Pennsylvania to get deeper look into soil. And finally researchers at USC study some of the smallest organisms in the ocean.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The members of the Five-0 investigate a journalist's past after he is killed; as Valentine's Day draws near, a text mix-up causes Danny to overreact.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Five-0 and an ATF agent (Melina Kanakaredes) from California team up when a serial arsonist targets couples in Oahu; Amber's abusive ex tracks her down while she is on a romantic getaway with Danny.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny and McGarrett work on their relationship as they pursue a woman who escaped after a diamond robbery.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Chin and Danny are taken into custody over past deadly transgressions, McGarrett turns to Joe for help.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and Odell come under assault at the barbershop while trying to protect a young man being hunted by a gang; Jerry is accused of a series of home invasions.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The wife of one of Grover's closest friends falls to her death; Dr. Shaw and Danny are stuck in an elevator with a body that needs processing.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: After a murder takes place at a convention of Elvis impersonators, the victim's body is stolen; Gabriel asks Chin for help.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a dead woman is found in a hotel suite belonging to three married, hungover men, the team must help them retrace their steps as they try to remember what happened -- and find the killer.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: During a solo outrigger trip, Kono encounters bad weather and must fight for her life; the Five-0 investigates a man in trouble for cooking meth.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: More than halfway through their time in jail, the participants struggle to make progress on their missions--as pod drama boils over, some hit their breaking point.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: The participants struggle with race politics, jailhouse thieves, and protecting their cover stories, but for one participant the secrets become too difficult to keep.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: The Sheriff and his team face a tough decision and the consequences of one participant's actions put the remaining participants in very real danger.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Now that one of the participants has blown his/her cover, Sheriff Lamb and his team are forced to make a decision.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: Police hope DNA evidence can locate the killers who gunned down a Cleveland man protecting his home on New Year's Eve.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: When a young Arizona businessman is found slaughtered in his bathroom, friends point police towards his ex-girlfriend; facing the death penalty, Jodi Arias takes the stand for 18 days in an attempt to explain how the killing was self-defense.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: When an off-duty Dallas police officer shoots a man in his own apartment, the jury decides if it was murder or a tragic mistake; Amber Guyger takes the stand in her own defense to convince the jury not to lock her away for up to 99 years.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: When a parolee is bounced from his job, he seeks retribution on a peaceful community when he kidnaps, tortures and kills a mother and caregiver; Scott Nelson takes the stand to give a convoluted explanation on why he blames his parole officer.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: Shayna Hubers takes the stand to defend herself after brutally murdering her on-again, off-again boyfriend, Ryan Poston; she willingly takes the stand to prove her actions were in self-defense, by showing Ryan's abusive side.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: A 23-year-old Texas man facing the death penalty after being charged with killing an elderly West Virginia couple, decides to take the stand and points the finger at a surprising suspect he claims committed the horrific crimes.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: Former Houston doctor Leon Jacob takes the stand to defend his past after being found guilty of plotting, along with girlfriend Valerie McDaniel, the murder of his ex-girlfriend and Valerie's ex-husband.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: When a young mother and her three children are brutally murdered in their suburban Florida home, an ex-boyfriend is charged with the killings; the jury has to decide if this was a crime of passion or a professional hit ordered by the cartel.

programme.title: Taking the Stand
programme.desc: Heather Elvis, 20, went missing on Dec. 18, 2013, and has never been found; Tammy Moorer, Heather's boyfriend's wife, is on trial for her kidnapping.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Genius is widely considered to be the ability to change the world in an incredible way, like inventing new technology, deciphering the mysteries of the universe, or creating transcendent art, but its origin is a mystery.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Humans can survive catastrophic injuries and deadly scenarios that defy the odds in ways that are inexplicable; these survivals challenge the best attempts to explain how anyone could live through such circumstances.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Many mysteries of planet Earth are far from understood. How was Devil's Tower formed? Or why do some people get struck by lightning multiple times?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Millions of people around the world claim to have had an encounter with a creature unlike any recognized by mainstream science.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: After Apollo 17 in 1972, the United States ends the Apollo program, leaving some to wonder if the astronauts found more than what NASA wants the public to know.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A shocking study reveals that the original builders of Stonehenge mysteriously vanished; but Stonehenge's mysterious Bluestone circle could have activated a portal that transported the ancient culture back to their former home among the stars.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Accounts of magic suggest possible evidence of advanced otherworldly knowledge.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The ancient site of Gobekli Tepe challenges what archaeologists believe about the past; the megalithic stone complex was built over 12,000 years ago, 5,000 years before the first known civilization was said to have emerged in Mesopotamia.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Examining some of the thousands of potentially habitable exoplanets discovered over the past 20 years and whether some of them could be home to intelligent extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Divine substances were consumed by the gods but sometimes gifted to humans to impart great power or wisdom; could the food of the gods be sustenance for alien visitors and does it lend insight into humanity's future.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists suggest that some extraterrestrials may closely resemble animals, as evidenced by gods depicted with animal traits; researchers suggest that some animals may have been planted here by aliens as part of an experiment to shape life on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Examining some of the thousands of potentially habitable exoplanets discovered over the past 20 years and whether some of them could be home to intelligent extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Divine substances were consumed by the gods but sometimes gifted to humans to impart great power or wisdom; could the food of the gods be sustenance for alien visitors and does it lend insight into humanity's future.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists suggest that some extraterrestrials may closely resemble animals, as evidenced by gods depicted with animal traits; researchers suggest that some animals may have been planted here by aliens as part of an experiment to shape life on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: After Apollo 17 in 1972, the United States ends the Apollo program, leaving some to wonder if the astronauts found more than what NASA wants the public to know.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Accounts of magic suggest possible evidence of advanced otherworldly knowledge.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On Christmas morning in 1945, five siblings vanish from their family home in West Virginia during a raging fire; despite the work of dozens of investigators and thousands of amateur sleuths, the mystery remains.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A series of unexplained deaths near Chicago in 1982 starts a nationwide panic; the victims are connected by one frightening detail: cyanide-tainted capsules of Extra-Strength Tylenol; 40 years later, it remains an active FBI investigation.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Booth family members share family lore, and what they believe is evidence of the assassin's escape, passed down through generations.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: With over 7,500 hours investigating the mystery; top D.B. Cooper expert Eric Ulis believes that he's found the true location where Cooper landed during his daring dive.

programme.title: Crime 360
programme.desc: On a hot summer day in Richmond, Detective Shane Waite is called to a local apartment complex where there is believed to be a dead body inside the trunk of a car.

programme.title: Crime 360
programme.desc: Two men who live next to each other in a housing project get into a deadly argument. One is shot and killed.

programme.title: Crime 360
programme.desc: Detectives Hank Veverka and Kathleen Carlin find the body of a 34 year-old male, shot to death behind an abandoned building.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Police have few clues in the disappearance of University of Iowa student Mollie Tibbetts until a local resident shares his garage surveillance camera footage; police later arrest Cristhian Bahena Rivera, who is living in the country illegally.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Police body cam video captures the cries of an Army sergeant as she cradles her dying husband in her arms; despite the happy outward appearance of the young military couple, investigators soon accuse the wife of directing a murder-for-hire plot.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Popular college senior Samantha Josephson goes missing after a night of socializing at a bar area popular with students; tragically, her body is found 24 hours later with more than 100 stab wounds.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: When Brandi Peters and her three children were found murdered, prosecutors pointed the ﬁnger at her ex, but as the trial got underway, an imprisoned drug dealer came forward.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Ichiro Suzuki plays in his final Major League game, announcing his retirement after the Mariners conclude a two-game series with the Athletics at the Tokyo Dome in Japan.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Roy Halladay outpitches Mark Buehrle in a duel on the mound in the Blue Jays' 2-0 win.

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: Look back at some of the most epic moments from the career of Ken Griffey Jr., as we celebrate "The Kid".

programme.title: Cathedrals of the Game
programme.desc: Take an exclusive tour of Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles, California. The legendary park has been home to the Dodgers since 1962 and is the largest ballpark in Major League Baseball.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Although this edition of the Fall Classic represented a rematch of the 1942 World Series, there were some familiar faces missing from both the Cardinals and Yankees due to World War II.

programme.title: All-Star Highlights
programme.desc: Bo Jackson and Wade Boggs power the American League to a 5-3 win over the National League.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Jim Leyland records his 700th win as manager in Detroit as the Tigers clinch the AL Central

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 2001 matchup between the D-backs and the Yankees. New York took a 3-2 series lead but strong pitching and a late-inning comeback in Game 7 led Arizona to knock off the defending champs securing the World Series title.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Yankees' rookie Aaron Judge wins the 2017 Home Run Derby at Marlins Park in Miami with a total of 47 home runs

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Benny Agbayani's go-ahead grand slam in the 11th wins it for the Mets in Tokyo, Japan.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/12/10: Cliff Lee puts together an impressive outing to pull off a complete game with 11 strikeouts in the Rangers' 5-1 win against the Rays in the 2010 American League Division Series.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: "Down one in the 11th, Ken Griffey Jr. scored from first on a Edgar Martinez double to win the ALDS.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Despite Josh Hamilton's historic first round, Justin Morneau goes on to defeat Hamilton in the final to win the Home Run Derby at Yankee Stadium.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Cleveland rallies from 12 runs down to win, 15-14, on Jolbert Cabrera's walk-off single in the 11th inning.

programme.title: MLB's Carded
programme.desc: Sean Casey walks us through his New Jersey baseball card store and joins Greg Amsinger on MLB's carded to talk about to talk about partner Fred Roth.

programme.title: All-Star Highlights
programme.desc: The NL storms back in the 9th and Jim Hickman wins the game on a walk-off single in the 12th

programme.title: MLB Network Countdown
programme.desc: Counting down the moments marked as famous firsts in MLB history, including two triple plays in a single game, father and son teammates homering in the same game, and more.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The Yankees hit three homers, highlighted by Judge's first postseason jack, to advance to the ALDS.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Israel defeats South Korea 2-1 in 10 innings in the 1st round of the 2017 World Baseball Classic.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Darryl Kile throws his first career no-hitter in a 7-1 win over the Mets.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: A.J. Burnett throws a no-hitter against the Padres, striking out seven batters and walking nine.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The National League battles back twice late in a thrilling victory, highlighted by clutch hits from Fred McGriff and Moises Alou. The 1994 MLB All-Star Game was the first NL win since 1987.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The team tries to correct flaws in a Mercedes Gullwing kit car.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '41 Chevy rolls in for a trunk-lid fix, but things go south quickly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Mercedes Gullwing build finally comes to an epic conclusion.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew swap the chassis of a 1955 Chevrolet Nomad.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A show in Stockton wants Dave to be a judge and to present a special award.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '63 Corvette gets an LSX engine, a larger transmission and new paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew stretches a '62 Corvette and makes some other improvements.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Vinnie Massaro is back looking to build the biggest, baddest Mopar ever.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Metal work on the '67 Coronet is done, so now it's on to the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1941 Chevy is finished in the metal shop and ready for paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is challenged restoring a 1964 Cadillac to its original condition.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the Kindig team add a tubbed bed and slivered Camaro bumpers to a classic Chevrolet C/K C-10.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The guys need to shake down a 1962 Corvette and make some design adjustments to a '55 Mercedes Gullwing; Kevin hunts for new ideas and rare finds in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A road warrior from Alaska arrives at the shop to add some improvements to an already solid build; to enhance performance, a new exhaust and tips are custom fabricated as well as a new set of wheels, tires and a custom interior.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple yet classy Pontiac Tempest arrives for a ground-up build, but things get complicated after the car is completely stripped.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pontiac Tempest build continues as bodywork is completed and Dave has designed a killer new color; Kevin shows off his powder-coating skills on a custom chassis.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave restarts work on a 1948 GMC truck that has been sitting in the back of the shop for three years.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin take the '67 Coronet, '55 Gullwing and '63 Corvette to a car show in Columbus, Ohio, where they will compete for street rod of the year.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave loves anything VW, and he finds a deal for a rare Transporter pickup that is too good to pass up. With a few modifications, he will finish the build, but then his real dilemma begins - whether to keep it or auction it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A car from Kindig’s past arrives back in the shop for an engine upgrade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Karmann Ghia aficionado wants some very specific upgrades for his new purchase. Custom trim, wheels, lowered stance, new paint and new upholstery are some of the items that will give this car a new lease on life.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The pieces that have arrived at the shop are allegedly for a Nova, but the only thing recognizable is the body; the challenge will be to piece car back together and get the body ready so the client can paint it himself.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client wants his '48 GMC to be Dave's baddest build ever, but when he throws Dave a curveball, it threatens the entire project. Celebrating 20 years in business, Kindig-It hosts a custom car show featuring a slew of past builds.

programme.title: The Nightcap

The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Tug of Words
programme.desc: Based on the playground game Tug-O-War, teams of two compete to answer word-clue questions correctly and pull the flag on the tug of war rope to their side.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 16 face off in their first team challenge, during which they cook lunch for first responders. Each team will have to create a dish featuring a delicious filet mignon and the guests will vote on which is better – the team with the most votes will win the challenge. Then, it’s up to the judges to determine which two cooks from the losing team will head home.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 14 receive a mystery box challenge inspired by the White House garden from former First Lady Michelle Obama. The young cooks must come up with an original recipe that is both healthy and presidential worthy, and the winner will receive a special once-in-a-lifetime opportunity! For the next challenge, Julie Bowen (“Modern Family”) steps into the MASTERCHEF kitchen to watch the kids make a dish in honor of their moms. Then, it’s up to the judges to decide which contestant will go home.

programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mike and Nellie's in New Jersey. With its putrid pasta sauces, overcooked shrimp plates, smelly carpets and dirty kitchen, Ramsay steps in to rejuvenate the joint.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: Frustrated after another lackluster dinner service, Chef Ramsay shares some of his experiences running a successful restaurant while setting the third night's competition.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Guest judge Richard Blais enters the kitchen to see what the kids can cook up. In the first challenge, the Top 12 junior home cooks team up into groups of three and have 10 minutes to make as many pies as possible. The winning team will be safe from elimination and will get to give the judges a sweet surprise! For the next challenge, the young chefs must use a blow torch to make either an appetizer, entrée, or dessert using ingredients from the MASTERCHEF pantry. Then, it’s up to the judges to decide who stays and who goes home?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi continues fending off Marik's attacks, holding out until he has the cards he needs to defeat Marik. Finally, he summons Dark Magician and Dark Magician Girl and uses them to activate Ragnarok – a spell card with the ability to destroy all the monsters on Marik's field, including The Winged Dragon of Ra that he fused himself with.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Odion tries to get the good Marik to resist his evil half. As a result, Yami Marik becomes angered, and attacks Odion with the Millennium Rod, which weakens Odion even more. Odion doesn't give up, despite Ishizu's protests. As Marik continues his onslaught (which begins to injure Odion), Odion tells Marik's good side that together, they had conquered his evil half before, and that they could do it again. Then, he tells the good Marik that since Yami Marik was created by the good Marik's hatred, he has the power to destroy him. As Yami Marik raises the Rod to deliver the final blow, the good Marik disappears from the field, and begins fighting against Yami Marik, who struggles for control over Marik's body, and refuses to be defeated. However, Marik's good half stalls Yami Marik long enough for Yugi to activate his spell card. Yugi's Ragnarok spell succeeds in destroying (and removing to the graveyard) Ra, allowing the good Marik to regain control of his body. However, a sliver of Yami Marik reappears on the field, although this time, he is the victim. Yami Marik tries to convince the good Marik to help him seize the Millennium Items and rule the world together, but fails as Marik has decided to stop being evil and make up for his actions. Marik surrenders the duel to Yugi, which sends Yami Marik to the Shadow Realm, ending the Battle City finals. Bakura and Mai are returned from the shadow realm and Marik is reunited with his siblings, who forgive him. Yugi receives the three Egyptian God Cards. Kaiba then activates the Duel Tower's self-destruct sequence, giving everybody one hour to get off the island before it explodes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation’s gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: With a push of ducks down from the north, the time is right to get into the timber and hunt! After several days of scouting and letting this block of timber rest the guys finally get in there and make it happen!!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's crew of waterfowl hunters get together for their annual Louisiana duck hunt. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and Michael Pitts head down south to get on the ducks. There's a lot of ducks around, but they're playing hard to get. So, the guys have to get creative to make it happen.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz chase long beards throughout the Midwest.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Editor-in-Chief Dan Schmidt heads to Devil's Tower in Carlile, Wyoming for some close encounters of the whitetail kind.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Southern Dirt
programme.desc: Kansas is such a special place, and Josh was fortunate enough to draw a tag. He heads West to hunt with Dan Cross at JD Outfitters trying to decoy a Kansas Buck.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: The guys with Pacific Calls are blown away by the Maxus II. “A pure waterfowlers gun.”

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: After Dan Schmidt passes on a giant Six-Pointer in deer camp, notorious bowhunter Bob Robb capitalizes on the opportunity to check off "mature six-pointer" from his bucket list.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: With so much focus on Chronic Wasting Disease, a more deadly disease is all to often being overlooked while it decimates deer herds across the world, that disease is EHD.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Everybody is always fighting about does. Should you shoot them? Should you not? Well the teams explains why you're all probably right and wrong in this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: It's lean, delicious, savory and the best part of the hunt. In this episode of Deer and Deer Hunting, Dan Schmidt, Mark Kayser and Brad Fenson share with us their thoughts on the other red meat, venison.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Join in as Randy and Cody are hard at work on the Raven Planting some Big Tine borderline on one of their favorite plots on the farm. Then learn all about their summer time clover plot maintenance routine.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma trying to run some trot lines on the North Canadian river but the water is just a little lower than they expected.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy, Cody, and Big Rig are still in Oklahoma with a long list of work to get done before fall comes. From moving blinds around to filling feeders the work never ends.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are back on the Raven in Missouri and with opening day of bow season fast approaching they are scrambling to get all the final prep work done and correct any mistakes they might have made along the way.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are still at the Dirty bird in Oklahoma, trying to get a few more tasks done before heading back to the Raven in Missouri. They also manage to get out and do a little velvet scouting with the Hawk spotting scope.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In most cases, the cameraman or woman hunts as well… Often their “play time” happens between scheduled season hunts for the show. But why don’t we see those? This year, I made it a point to film all of my camera girl’s hunts and decided to make an episode out of it. Without help, none of this possible! So to all the camera operators, behind the scenes industry folks… Thank you and this is for you!!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode we kick off with calling in a bird for the Bellator Light Heavyweight Champ, Corey Anderson on a farm in Kentucky. We roll up to Ohio and double up on a foggy morning, then it was back to Iowa where John linked up with Skyline Motorsports Crew Chief of the #16 Longhorn, Zeb to chase birds in NE Iowa. Another double to close out the season! 5 turkeys in the episode, Enjoy!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John competes in another Tactical Games event in Pennsylvania and a Total Archery Challenge. If you’re not familiar with these…. The Tactical Games is a cross fit meets 2 Gun style competition. The TAC events are a big Archery 3D fun shoot with targets ranging from 15 to 120 yds! If you’ve never done one of these, DO IT!!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John travels to Arizona at the end of June for an OTC Rifle Elk hunt! This rare opportunity due to Arizona opening a summer tag on private and state land allows non residents to obtain a chance at a velvet bull! High temps and high anticipation are filled with this hunt!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Rigsby Stewart makes a move to punch his tag in Nebraska! Nothing came easy on this hunt! Multiple different weather conditions and wind directions proved challenging!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell sit down to discuss the week No. 1 ups and downs, and what they learned during their first run hunting public ducks up north.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan is hunting a true giant at one of his favorite places to hunt in the Southeast. Honeybrake has been a great place to deer hunt for the Realtree crew over the last few years. Tyler Jordan and Ben McDonald decide to try their luck bowhunting at Honeybrake for a couple true southern ghosts.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Public competition, little sleep, mother nature, and a wrong turn. It's a rough weekend for the Arkansas opener but Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell wouldn't be anywhere else. It's the Super Bowl of Duck Hunting and everyone is ready to hit the timber.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Mike heads to Table Rock Lake to meet up with Trenton and his family. Even battling the tough fishing conditions following a heavy front, there’s never a lack of family time, laughs or friendly competitions with the Southards.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton is headed to meet up with Andrew Norbye on Lake Guntersville in Alabama. With not a lot of current being pulled, the deep schools weren’t set up to feed. So they went up shallow to fish grass until evening time when the ledge fish really started biting.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Rex meets up with “Mr Crappie” Wally Marshall in Texas. Wally takes Rex to one of his secret spots to put the hammer on the crappie. Not only did they catch crappie, but nice largemouth and some top tier coppernose bluegill.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew heads to Rivers Lodge and Hunt Club in Kansas to fish strip pits. Trenton and Rex take on Mike and Nate in a 3 period mini tournament. With multiple species allowed including northern pike, the two teams are neck and neck after the first two periods. Due to bad weather on day 2, period 3 turned into a hour speed round where only keeper largemouth count.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton meets up with Tom Brewbaker as they fly down to Venice Louisiana to fish with Mike Frenette. Mike runs the Redfish Lodge of Louisiana and has over forty years of angling experience. Mike teaches the guys about the local waters including pogey boats and most importantly, world class red fish.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton goes down North Carolina to learn the family secrets of the Forehand family. Ben Forehand is a guitarist for Christian Contemporary artist Pat Barret. When Ben isn’t playing guitar, he runs Wild and Free Outfitters getting people into the outdoors hunting and fishing, getting their minds off of the everyday grind. . Even though fishing is tough the guys build strong friendships and lasting memories.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesn’t hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the event’s epic dockside party.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin invites life long PCB resident Griff Griffiths onboard and reveals the silver king migration is happening right in the midst all the beach-goers activities. Then ultimately landing his first local tarpon right on the beach he grew up on.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor bounce around the Florida Bay Everglades for triple tail.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowand and Rich Tudor are joined by Key West guide Nick LaBadie.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor enjoy a productive day in the Florida Bay area of the Everglades

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head out from their Middle Keys home base to deeper waters.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor venture to the Atlantic oceanside of the Keys for Blackfin Tuna.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head to the Lower Keys for Tarpon and various types of Jacks.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Brad Rucks gets a chance to punch a long awaited Wisconsin sturgeon tag and then chats with the local DNR to learn about sturgeon spawning season.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in Croatia, and on the third day, they decide to venture to the coast where he will pursue his hunt on one of the numerous islands that permit hunting (Dugi Otok Island). Armedwith his trusted Gunwerks 7LRM Rifle, Mark prepares to stalk the diverse array of exotic animals inhabiting these islands, offering him a rich selection of prey to choose from.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Cajun classics are met with a Zimbabwean flair in this delicious mashup of cultures. programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Join us at Pelican’s Roost in Delacroix, LA, where Captain Sean Thornton and Chef Jay Ducote were able to share the full Louisiana Catch & Cook experience with Texas Food Personality Trey “Chow Down” Chapman—with delicious results.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Louisiana’s Cajun Ninja joins Chef Jay Ducote in our latest catch-and-cook adventure. Tag along as they hit up the hottest fishing spots in Plaquemines Parish with Captain Shane York and turn their catches into authentic Cajun meals.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, it’s no different. With Winchester’s in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Everybody is always fighting about does. Should you shoot them? Should you not? Well the teams explains why you're all probably right and wrong in this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Join in as Randy and Cody are hard at work on the Raven Planting some Big Tine borderline on one of their favorite plots on the farm. Then learn all about their summer time clover plot maintenance routine.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma trying to run some trot lines on the North Canadian river but the water is just a little lower than they expected.

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In most cases, the cameraman or woman hunts as well… Often their “play time” happens between scheduled season hunts for the show. But why don’t we see those? This year, I made it a point to film all of my camera girl’s hunts and decided to make an episode out of it. Without help, none of this possible! So to all the camera operators, behind the scenes industry folks… Thank you and this is for you!!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode we kick off with calling in a bird for the Bellator Light Heavyweight Champ, Corey Anderson on a farm in Kentucky. We roll up to Ohio and double up on a foggy morning, then it was back to Iowa where John linked up with Skyline Motorsports Crew Chief of the #16 Longhorn, Zeb to chase birds in NE Iowa. Another double to close out the season! 5 turkeys in the episode, Enjoy!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John competes in another Tactical Games event in Pennsylvania and a Total Archery Challenge. If you’re not familiar with these…. The Tactical Games is a cross fit meets 2 Gun style competition. The TAC events are a big Archery 3D fun shoot with targets ranging from 15 to 120 yds! If you’ve never done one of these, DO IT!!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John travels to Arizona at the end of June for an OTC Rifle Elk hunt! This rare opportunity due to Arizona opening a summer tag on private and state land allows non residents to obtain a chance at a velvet bull! High temps and high anticipation are filled with this hunt!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Rigsby Stewart makes a move to punch his tag in Nebraska! Nothing came easy on this hunt! Multiple different weather conditions and wind directions proved challenging!

programme.title: Black Cloud

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips

Honeybrake has been a great place to deer hunt for the Realtree crew over the last few years. programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Public competition, little sleep, mother nature, and a wrong turn. It's a rough weekend for the Arkansas opener but Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell wouldn't be anywhere else. It's the Super Bowl of Duck Hunting and everyone is ready to hit the timber.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Mike heads to Table Rock Lake to meet up with Trenton and his family. Even battling the tough fishing conditions following a heavy front, there’s never a lack of family time, laughs or friendly competitions with the Southards.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton is headed to meet up with Andrew Norbye on Lake Guntersville in Alabama. With not a lot of current being pulled, the deep schools weren’t set up to feed. So they went up shallow to fish grass until evening time when the ledge fish really started biting.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Rex meets up with “Mr Crappie” Wally Marshall in Texas. Wally takes Rex to one of his secret spots to put the hammer on the crappie. Not only did they catch crappie, but nice largemouth and some top tier coppernose bluegill.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew heads to Rivers Lodge and Hunt Club in Kansas to fish strip pits. Trenton and Rex take on Mike and Nate in a 3 period mini tournament. With multiple species allowed including northern pike, the two teams are neck and neck after the first two periods. Due to bad weather on day 2, period 3 turned into a hour speed round where only keeper largemouth count.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton meets up with Tom Brewbaker as they fly down to Venice Louisiana to fish with Mike Frenette. Mike runs the Redfish Lodge of Louisiana and has over forty years of angling experience. Mike teaches the guys about the local waters including pogey boats and most importantly, world class red fish.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton goes down North Carolina to learn the family secrets of the Forehand family. Ben Forehand is a guitarist for Christian Contemporary artist Pat Barret. When Ben isn’t playing guitar, he runs Wild and Free Outfitters getting people into the outdoors hunting and fishing, getting their minds off of the everyday grind. . Even though fishing is tough the guys build strong friendships and lasting memories.

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara spend the last night of the year on the ice chasing crappies after dark!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara head to Tamarack Island and explain why when ice fishing big water being able to breakdown structure is critical to success.

Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: It Happened to Jane
programme.desc: When a shipment of expired shellfish arrives to her New England lobstery, Jane Osgood decides to take a capitalist railroad tycoon to court.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they’re the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: Baby the Rain Must Fall

programme.title: Sword of Sherwood Forest
programme.desc: After infiltrating a group of insurrectionists, Greene discovers their plan to murder the Archbishop of Canterbury and to take over Bawtry Castle.

programme.desc: Nick Romano (James Darren) lives in a poor tenement building on the south side of Chicago with his well-meaning but drug-addicted mother, Nellie (Shelley Winters). She encourages him to pursue his piano-playing talent in hopes that it will bring him a better life. Nellie's neighbors, like the alcoholic ex-lawyer (Burl Ives) who secretly loves her, help her in keeping Nick away from Louie, the resident drug dealer. But a chance meeting between Nick and Louie could change things forever.

programme.title: Decameron Nights

programme.title: The Lone Wolf Takes a Chance

programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: To settle an old score, a father and his sons rob a cattle-swindling rancher, go into hiding, and soon find a posse of townsfolk after them.

programme.title: Out West With the Peppers

programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons

programme.title: Blazing Across the Pecos

programme.title: Banjo Hackett

programme.desc: Widowed Les Martin (Cornel Wilde) is an ex-detective haunted by a case he left behind in Denver. Now, Martin is the deputy sheriff of a small Arizona town with nothing to do but pull over beautiful local socialite Janice Kendon (Victoria Shaw) for occasional speeding -- until a mysterious murder at a nearby ghost town requires him to put his old skills to use once again. With the help of Sheriff Edwards (Edgar Buchanan) and Kendon, Martin must unravel a murderous plot involving stolen gold.

programme.title: Gunfighters

programme.title: Prairie Schooners

programme.title: The Last Frontier

Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: The Walking Hills
programme.desc: During a poker game in a Mexican bar, a group of men discover the location of a lost wagon train -- and its cargo of gold. To prevent one man from cheating the rest, it's decided that they will find it together. Among them are horse breeder Jim Carey (Randolph Scott) and rodeo rider Shep Wilson (William Bishop) ; like their cohorts in the treasure hunt, they share a tangled history -- Chris Jackson (Ella Raines), Shep's current sweetheart, is Jim's old flame. Greed and suspicion soon break out.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: The Last Posse
programme.desc: To settle an old score, a father and his sons rob a cattle-swindling rancher, go into hiding, and soon find a posse of townsfolk after them.

programme.title: Out West With the Peppers
programme.desc: The widowed Mrs. Pepper and her five children face new challenges and adventures when they move west to stay with her sister and her ornery husband.

Determined to clear Mahoney's name, postal worker Steve Reynolds (Charles Starrett) transforms himself into the masked rider known as the Durango Kid.

While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.
